basics.name: Stephanie Wong
basics.label: System Engineer
basics.summary: A passionate engineer with a keen focus on optimizing processes and continuous improvement. Proactive team player and a fast learner, with a strong ability to adapt and learn independently.

work.name: TDRAGONCARDS.COM, Singapore
work.summary:
• Create card designs using Adobe Illustrator
  • Basic photo editing with Adobe Photoshop

work.name: Republic Polytechnic, Singapore
work.summary:
• Assisted lecturers with research projects in an alumni-only research position.
  • Developed a health tracker prototype using Arduino, with gyroscope, accelerometer and thermometer sensors, together with Bluetooth for data transmission to a gateway and web dashboard for caregiver monitoring.
  • Created proof-of-concept hardware with breadboards and soldered working prototypes for exhibitions.
  • Contributed to a real-time logistics web tracker by developing the web interface using HTML, CSS, jQuery, MySQL, AJAX, and WebSockets for live updates.
  • Designed a virtual campus tour in Unity, importing BIM data, applying textures, and enabling user interaction with an Xbox Kinect camera.

work.name: The Garden Slug LLP, Singapore
work.summary:
• Took a gap year to explore other careers
  • Create customized drinks for customers
  • Provided quality customer service and managed point-of-sale systems.
  • Handled general stock-taking responsibilities for the restaurant.
  • Decided to return to the tech industry after realizing it was a better fit.

work.name: CNS Connections Pte Ltd, Singapore
work.summary:
• Hired as a Frontend Web Developer to design and create HTML prototypes based on client requirements before integrating with WordPress CMS.
  • Performed integration checks to ensure websites were bug-free post-CMS integration.
  • Developed an inventory management web application using PHP and MySQL.
  • Assisted with digital ads, video editing, Flash animations, and IT support, evolving the role into a Multimedia Developer position.
  • Led the iOS app development for the companyâ€™s entertainment content platform during a website overhaul, collaborating with a team of four to design and develop the app despite no prior mobile development experience.
  • Worked with two UI/UX designers to brainstorm and iterate on app and website designs, successfully completing the project in 10 months.

work.name: Ministry of Defence, Singapore
work.summary:
• Managed website, ensuring timely uploads of authorized content.
  • Maintained static webpages for sub-sites pending migration to the CMS.
  • Debugged integration across frontend (HTML/JavaScript/CSS) and backend (IBM Web Content Manager).
  • Took initiative to transition from consultant to product manager for a stalled web project.
  • Managed the project across multiple vendors and integrated with Adobe Experience Manager & Analytics.
  • Successfully brought the project live by Q1 2019 as scheduled.

work.name: Government Technology Agency, Singapore
work.summary:
• Worked on a smart garden project, retrofitting lamp posts with IoT-capable nodes.
  • Designed software architecture for the end nodes, using Modbus protocols for communication.
  • Hand soldered components and created prototypes using STM32 Nucleo boards.
  • Collaborated with hardware engineers to create custom PCB boards using STM32L and STM32F microcontrollers.
  • Utilized Mbed OS for rapid prototyping, building firmware in C/C++.
  • Assumed project lead role, overseeing development, deployment, and maintenance of the devices.

work.name: Government Technology Agency, Singapore
work.summary:
• Designed system architecture for frontend dashboards and backend services.
  • Developed fullstack dashboards using Next.js (frontend) and Express.js (backend).
  • Built UI/UX with Mantine components and custom icons designed in Figma.
  • Implemented Redis for caching and fast in-memory JSON data access.
  • Integrated Keycloak for OAuth2 authentication and role-based access control.
  • Containerized applications with Docker/Podman and deployed to Azure Kubernetes.
  • Enabled real-time communication with RabbitMQ using AMQP and Protobuf.
  • Added features to Unity-based digital twin for physical asset management.
  • Authored UAT documentation, test cases, and conducted user workshops.
  • Addressed vulnerabilities via VAPT participation and resolution efforts.
  • Led coding standardization, documentation improvements, and DevOps enhancements.
  • Led frontend team and mentored junior developers.

certificates.name: Specialist Certificate: Object Oriented Design and Programming
SEC542: Web App Penetration Testing and Ethical Hacking
